result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn A DeBona was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: consecutive to count 2 (consecutive to each other) with credit for 5 days time served. STAYED and placed on probation.

miscConds.notes:
-Cooperate with the Department
-Department can determine if anger management is necessary
-No violent conact with juvenile CC
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary
-Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random screens

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample surcharge waived as the court finds an inability to pay.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
consecutive to count 1 with credit for 5 days time served.
Consecutive to: to count 1  (consecutive to each other)
Concurrent with: concurrent with count one

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dawn A DeBona

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Copy sent to Probation and Parole Agent # 31709.

HEARD IN BR 34 FOR BR 40
Defendant Dawn A DeBona in court with attorney Joel Mogren.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction-each count consecutive, with credit for 5 DAYS time served each count.  This sentence is STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:
-Cooperate with the Department
-Department can determine if anger management is necessary
-No violent conact with juvenile CC
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary
-Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random screens

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample surcharge waived as the court finds an inability to pay.
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw
**********
Attorney Mogren advised he is waiving any fees owing to him.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Branch 34 agreed to take the case.  rmm
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.

Defendant Dawn A DeBona in court with attorney Joel Mogren.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1:  Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class A Misdemeanor and COUNT 2:  Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dawn A DeBona in court.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Attorney Joel Mogren called and informed the clerk he is ill.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no violent contact order remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm
Attorney Fee Trust  Escrow payment plan has been created 5/9/2014 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. Cases include 2014CF001641. sdg
By stipulation of the parties, Court ordered the no contact order modified to allow for now violent contact as long as defendant is complying with Justice Point and Children's Court orders.

Defendant Dawn A DeBona in court with attorney Joel Mogren.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Dawn A DeBona in court with attorney Joel Mogren.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Joel Mogren as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Mogren accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing June 1, 2014 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 40 on 05/07/2014.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Timothy C. or C.C. (DOB:  10/17/2000).

Defendant Dawn A DeBona in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Dawn A DeBona in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for public defender representation due to spouse's income.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
